thread.title: Estonia Discovers 800 New IslandsTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Estonia Discovers 800 New IslandsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Estonia Discovers 800 New Islands
Cartographers discover hundreds of yet unrecognised islands in Baltic Sea adding 38.6 square miles to the country’s overall territory.
Recent discovery pushes the total count of Estonian islands to 2,222, or 2,355 if those in lakes are included. The revision is thanks to new surveying by the Estonian Land Board, which used aerial photography and laser scanning to update its topographical maps. It means that the total size of the Estonian territory is revised upwards by 38.6 square miles (100 square kilometres).
Estonia’s largest islands of Saaremaa, Hiiumaa, Muhumaa and Vormsi have a lengthy history and are popular getaways for nature holidaymakers.
Source:- Visit Estonia
